news_header: China's central bank cuts interest rates to boost consumption amid economic concerns.
news_text: China's central bank has reduced interest rates on mortgage loans and construction to historic lows of 3.1% and 3.6%, respectively, in an effort to accelerate consumption. This follows a previous rate cut in July. However, the country's cautious economic behavior and ongoing long-term debt crisis pose risks to its 5% growth target for the year. Consequently, stock exchange rates in China and Hong Kong fell after trading began.
